name: Shohag Loves Mod
statement: Shohag has an integer $$$n$$$. Please help him find an increasing integer sequence $$$1 \le a_1 \lt a_2 \lt \ldots \lt a_n \le 100$$$ such that $$$a_i \bmod i \neq a_j \bmod j$$$ $$$^{\text{∗}}$$$ is satisfied over all pairs $$$1 \le i \lt j \le n$$$. It can be shown that such a sequence always exists under the given constraints. $$$^{\text{∗}}$$$$$$a \bmod b$$$ denotes the remainder of $$$a$$$ after division by $$$b$$$. For example, $$$7 \bmod 3 = 1, 8 \bmod 4 = 0$$$ and $$$69 \bmod 10 = 9$$$.
inputFormat: The first line contains a single integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \le t \le 50$$$) — the number of test cases. The first and only line of each test case contains an integer $$$n$$$ ($$$2 \le n \le 50$$$).
outputFormat: For each test case, print $$$n$$$ integers — the integer sequence that satisfies the conditions mentioned in the statement. If there are multiple such sequences, output any.
